content: only rs facing row i stopped at 35 row now you will make another row to even out the edging from the ripple to a straight edge with the wrong side facing - *single_crochet flo in the first two stitches half_double_crochet flo in the next stitch double_crochet flo in the next two stitches half_double_crochet flo in the next stitch single_crochet flo in the next two stitches* repeat from * to * all the way around join with a slip_stitch to the first single_crochet ru>le border note switch color here if you d like the ruyle to be a diyerent color yarn row 1 with rs facing - single_crochet all the way around in both loops join with a slip_stitch into the first single_crochet chain 1 do not turn row 2 - stay on rs make a stacked single_crochet into the first stitch 2 double_crochet into the same stitch 3 double_crochet into each single_crochet all the way around note if you prefer not to use a stacked single_crochet you can chain 2 at the end of row 1 instead drawstring you can make a drawstring in whichever manner you re most comfortable with such as using a simple long chain i prefer to make an i-cord determine how long you want your drawstring to be i make sure it wraps around my waist and can tie and make a bow then make your yarn tail 5x as long as that length you may get away with 3-4x your preferred length depending on your gauge but i like to really make sure i have enough length so i don t have to re-do the cord because i run out of yarn do not cut yarn make a slip knot at this point in the yarn take your tail end and wrap it around your hook once from bottom to top 2 loops on hook take the working end of the yarn and yarn over and pull through both loops on the hook continue this wrapping the tail around once and pulling through both loops with the working end until your drawstring is at the length you want cut yarn tie a knot and weave your ends back into the drawstring using a yarn needle carefully weave the drawstring through the waistband of the skirt leaving the front center where the drawstring ends meet i like to weave under every other rib weave your ends in and block if needed pattern chart for skirt body
